Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to inform authorities of address change under Immigration Act
Legal_Issue: Does the statutory stay under s. 49(1)(c)(i) of the Immigration Act apply when an application for leave and judicial review is made out of time?
Outcome: The removal order was stayed by operation of law under s. 49(1)(c)(i); no further court order required.
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application included an extension request; the court analyzed stare decisis and relevant statutes.
Basis_of_Claim: Ziyadah missed the deadline for filing his judicial review but applied for an extension.
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Statutory stay applies even if application is late, ensuring consistency and rationality in the law.
Application_Error: Missed judicial review deadline due to failure to update address
Review_Outcome: Stay of removal granted by operation of law
Legal_Standard: Interpretation of statutory stay under s. 49(1)(c)(i)
Application_Factor: Intent to file judicial review despite late filing
Decision_Review_Issue: Applicability of statutory stay to out-of-time applications
Outcome_of_Review: Motion for stay dismissed as unnecessary due to automatic statutory stay
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Request for extension of time to file judicial review
Jurisdictional_Focus: Immigration and Refugee Board / Federal Court
Procedural_Issue: Late filing of judicial review application
Omission_Type: Failure to inform authorities of address change

Legal_Issue: Does Section 49(1)(c)(i) of the Immigration Act apply to stay a removal order when an application for judicial review is filed out of time?
Application_Facts: Ziyadah overstayed his visa, applied for refugee status, which was rejected, and filed for judicial review outside prescribed time.
Decision_Outcome: Removal order stayed by operation of law under Section 49(1)(c)(i).
Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending judicial review
Court_Ruling: Adopted Mackay, J.'s reasoning: statutory stay applies even if application is late.
Defendant_Behavior: Filed out-of-time judicial review application with extension request under Section 82.1(5)
Grounds_for_Claim: Seeking to prevent removal during judicial review process
Legal_Standard: Interpretation of statutory stay under s. 49(1)(c)(i)
Assessment_Factor: Timeliness of judicial review application and intent to file
Procedural_Issue: Late filing of judicial review application
Application_Basis: Filing or intention to file judicial review
Outcome: Removal order stayed by operation of law; motion for stay dismissed as unnecessary
Cause_Description: Refugee claim rejected leading to removal order; sought stay pending judicial review
Residency_Compliance: Non-compliance with visa conditions due to overstay
Decision_Rationale: Ensuring consistency and rationality in the law by applying statutory stay regardless of timeliness
